column5: i guess it was skinny, but it was still beautiful fish!
Whats the biggest Walleye caught so far this year by all the WC experts?
Personally 26.5 A son of my friend - 28.5
my buddy caught a 34 inch, 10pound 10 once beauty. i still can't believe i even witnessed it.
34"---10lb 10oz..????? must have been a skinny girl. Still a nice fish.

My son caught the large walleye for our group - a 28 1/2" golden beauty......I did catch the first one, though it was a 14" (ha) ! I told my son at least he kept the "big walleye" for the week at the camp (www.campkuha.com) in the family ! Had a great week (our group booked 3 out of the 4 cabins) and after fish frys, steak frys and a few cold ones, I didn't want to go back to work ! The good vacations go by too fast, and work goes by tooooo slow !
Mine was a 29.5", 11 pounder. Soaked her in milk and fried her up. Best darn walleye I ever tasted!
Dick is full of it, i was with his group and he never caught one over 15 inches. He was too busy drinking beer and wiping chew spit off his chin.

Actually Dick did get a 29.5 inch 11 pounder, but as crosseyed and hammered as he was he did not realize it was a Carp and not a Walleye. This and the fact that he has caught very few Walleyes in his day, any fish he catches if it has any goldish hue at all he calls it a Walleye. He said it was the best fish he'd ever eaten.

I submitted one to the 10 pound club this year. I didn't take any measurements before I let her go so I couldn't tell ya what it weighed. Here's the picture.https://www.walleyecentral.com/fish_mahumba.shtml Roger Mayer.

Dick did catch it...I saw him. What he doesn't say is that he caught it two years ago as a 21 incher and kept it penned feeding it steroids and little bits of musky meat to fatten it up. Then he tied up a perch as bait and re-caught the baby. He served it up with some Bald Eagle wings ( cooked Buffalo-style, of course). Yuuuummmmyyyy.
